name: Monkfish Osso Bucco with Gremolata
recipeInstructions: 1. Mix all the ingredients for the gremolade in a small glass bowl, season, then set aside.
3. Melt half the butter in a medium sized heavy based saucepan over a low to medium heat and cook the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery until soft, without colouring.
4. Add the saffron, thyme, and tomato puree and cook for a minute.
5. Stir in the white wine and reduce by three quarters.
6. Add the beef stock, bring to the boil and simmer until reduced by half.
7. Set aside until the monkfish is ready.
8. Lightly flour and season the monkfish.
9. Heat a nonstick frying pan until smoking, add the fish, and cook for 3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
10. Transfer to an oven proof dish and place in the oven for 8 minutes.
11. Reheat the sauce and whisk in the rest of the butter.
12. Place the fish on plates, pour over the sauce, then drizzle with gremolata.

tool.name: Metal handled frying pan (suitable for the oven).
